topic.name: Medication Safety Drills
topic.description: Rapid-fire pharmacology prompts that reinforce safe administration.

questions.text: Which medication or class reduce blood pressure by blocking angiotensin II formation and commonly trigger a nagging dry cough?
questions.explanation: ACE inhibitors reduce blood pressure by blocking angiotensin II formation and commonly trigger a nagging dry cough.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to are linked to rising potassium and creatinine, so labs must be trended?
questions.explanation: ACE inhibitors is linked to are linked to rising potassium and creatinine, so labs must be trended.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to require the nurse to monitor closely for first-dose hypotension when the client stands?
questions.explanation: ACE inhibitors therapy requires nurses to require the nurse to monitor closely for first-dose hypotension when the client stands.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes teaching stresses avoiding potassium-based salt substitutes and reporting facial swelling immediately?
questions.explanation: Clients on ACE inhibitors must remember to teaching stresses avoiding potassium-based salt substitutes and reporting facial swelling immediately.

questions.text: Which medication or class block angiotensin II receptors to lower blood pressure without provoking cough?
questions.explanation: ARBs block angiotensin II receptors to lower blood pressure without provoking cough.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to carry hyperkalemia risk in clients with renal impairment?
questions.explanation: ARBs is linked to carry hyperkalemia risk in clients with renal impairment.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to require periodic assessment of blood pressure and renal perfusion when paired with diuretics?
questions.explanation: ARBs therapy requires nurses to require periodic assessment of blood pressure and renal perfusion when paired with diuretics.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes teaching includes limiting NSAID overuse that blunts the antihypertensive effect?
questions.explanation: Clients on ARBs must remember to teaching includes limiting NSAID overuse that blunts the antihypertensive effect.

questions.text: Which medication or class produce rapid anxiolysis by enhancing GABA?
questions.explanation: Benzodiazepines produce rapid anxiolysis by enhancing GABA.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to can create dependence and need gradual tapering after long-term use?
questions.explanation: Benzodiazepines is linked to can create dependence and need gradual tapering after long-term use.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to require fall precautions due to sedation and ataxia?
questions.explanation: Benzodiazepines therapy requires nurses to require fall precautions due to sedation and ataxia.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes clients avoid concurrent alcohol or opioids that magnify respiratory depression?
questions.explanation: Clients on Benzodiazepines must remember to clients avoid concurrent alcohol or opioids that magnify respiratory depression.

questions.text: Which medication or class slow heart rate and reduce contractility to lower myocardial oxygen demand?
questions.explanation: Beta blockers slow heart rate and reduce contractility to lower myocardial oxygen demand.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to can mask early signs of hypoglycemia in insulin-dependent clients?
questions.explanation: Beta blockers is linked to can mask early signs of hypoglycemia in insulin-dependent clients.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to require nurses to hold the dose for marked bradycardia or symptomatic hypotension?
questions.explanation: Beta blockers therapy requires nurses to require nurses to hold the dose for marked bradycardia or symptomatic hypotension.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes counseling includes tapering rather than abruptly stopping therapy?
questions.explanation: Clients on Beta blockers must remember to counseling includes tapering rather than abruptly stopping therapy.

questions.text: Which medication or class promote arterial dilation to treat hypertension and chronic angina?
questions.explanation: Calcium channel blockers promote arterial dilation to treat hypertension and chronic angina.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to can prolong PR interval when combined with beta blockers?
questions.explanation: Calcium channel blockers is linked to can prolong PR interval when combined with beta blockers.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to require monitoring for peripheral edema and orthostatic hypotension?
questions.explanation: Calcium channel blockers therapy requires nurses to require monitoring for peripheral edema and orthostatic hypotension.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes teaching includes slow position changes and daily weights if swelling appears?
questions.explanation: Clients on Calcium channel blockers must remember to teaching includes slow position changes and daily weights if swelling appears.

questions.text: Which medication or class increases contractility while slowing AV conduction in heart failure?
questions.explanation: Digoxin increases contractility while slowing AV conduction in heart failure.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to becomes toxic faster with hypokalemia or renal impairment?
questions.explanation: Digoxin is linked to becomes toxic faster with hypokalemia or renal impairment.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to requires counting the apical pulse for a full minute before dosing?
questions.explanation: Digoxin therapy requires nurses to requires counting the apical pulse for a full minute before dosing.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes teaching highlights reporting anorexia, nausea, or visual halos immediately?
questions.explanation: Clients on Digoxin must remember to teaching highlights reporting anorexia, nausea, or visual halos immediately.

questions.text: Which medication or class directly inhibit factor Xa without routine lab draws?
questions.explanation: Direct oral anticoagulants directly inhibit factor Xa without routine lab draws.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to have limited reversal options, so bleeding risk counseling is essential?
questions.explanation: Direct oral anticoagulants is linked to have limited reversal options, so bleeding risk counseling is essential.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to require renal function checks before dosing?
questions.explanation: Direct oral anticoagulants therapy requires nurses to require renal function checks before dosing.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes clients are instructed to take doses consistently and not double missed tablets?
questions.explanation: Clients on Direct oral anticoagulants must remember to clients are instructed to take doses consistently and not double missed tablets.

questions.text: Which medication or class potentiates antithrombin III for rapid anticoagulation?
questions.explanation: Heparin potentiates antithrombin III for rapid anticoagulation.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to can precipitate heparin-induced thrombocytopenia requiring platelet surveillance?
questions.explanation: Heparin is linked to can precipitate heparin-induced thrombocytopenia requiring platelet surveillance.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to requires monitoring aPTT and adjusting infusions per protocol?
questions.explanation: Heparin therapy requires nurses to requires monitoring aPTT and adjusting infusions per protocol.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes teaching includes reporting new bruising or bleeding gums right away?
questions.explanation: Clients on Heparin must remember to teaching includes reporting new bruising or bleeding gums right away.

questions.text: Which medication or class provides 24-hour basal insulin coverage without pronounced peaks?
questions.explanation: Insulin glargine provides 24-hour basal insulin coverage without pronounced peaks.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to is titrated based on fasting glucose patterns rather than meal counts?
questions.explanation: Insulin glargine is linked to is titrated based on fasting glucose patterns rather than meal counts.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to requires using a dedicated syringe and never mixing with other insulins?
questions.explanation: Insulin glargine therapy requires nurses to requires using a dedicated syringe and never mixing with other insulins.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes teaching stresses injecting at the same time daily even when skipping meals?
questions.explanation: Clients on Insulin glargine must remember to teaching stresses injecting at the same time daily even when skipping meals.

questions.text: Which medication or class is rapid acting and should be given within 15 minutes of meals?
questions.explanation: Insulin lispro is rapid acting and should be given within 15 minutes of meals.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to is dosed based on carbohydrate ratios to blunt postprandial spikes?
questions.explanation: Insulin lispro is linked to is dosed based on carbohydrate ratios to blunt postprandial spikes.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to requires nurses to ensure a meal tray is present before administration?
questions.explanation: Insulin lispro therapy requires nurses to requires nurses to ensure a meal tray is present before administration.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes teaching includes carrying fast carbohydrates to correct sudden hypoglycemia?
questions.explanation: Clients on Insulin lispro must remember to teaching includes carrying fast carbohydrates to correct sudden hypoglycemia.

questions.text: Which medication or class replaces thyroid hormone in hypothyroidism?
questions.explanation: Levothyroxine replaces thyroid hormone in hypothyroidism.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to requires TSH monitoring every 6–8 weeks to fine-tune the dose?
questions.explanation: Levothyroxine is linked to requires TSH monitoring every 6–8 weeks to fine-tune the dose.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to must be taken each morning on an empty stomach for consistent absorption?
questions.explanation: Levothyroxine therapy requires nurses to must be taken each morning on an empty stomach for consistent absorption.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes patients separate doses from calcium or iron supplements by several hours?
questions.explanation: Clients on Levothyroxine must remember to patients separate doses from calcium or iron supplements by several hours.

questions.text: Which medication or class stabilizes mood by modulating neurotransmission?
questions.explanation: Lithium stabilizes mood by modulating neurotransmission.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to has a narrow therapeutic window of roughly 0.6–1.2 mEq/L?
questions.explanation: Lithium is linked to has a narrow therapeutic window of roughly 0.6–1.2 mEq/L.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to requires monitoring sodium and hydration to avoid toxicity?
questions.explanation: Lithium therapy requires nurses to requires monitoring sodium and hydration to avoid toxicity.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes clients keep salt intake consistent and report tremors or diarrhea immediately?
questions.explanation: Clients on Lithium must remember to clients keep salt intake consistent and report tremors or diarrhea immediately.

questions.text: Which medication or class rapidly offload fluid to relieve pulmonary edema and heart failure symptoms?
questions.explanation: Loop diuretics rapidly offload fluid to relieve pulmonary edema and heart failure symptoms.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to at high doses may cause ototoxicity, especially with other ototoxic drugs?
questions.explanation: Loop diuretics is linked to at high doses may cause ototoxicity, especially with other ototoxic drugs.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to require verifying potassium levels and supplementing losses?
questions.explanation: Loop diuretics therapy requires nurses to require verifying potassium levels and supplementing losses.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes patient teaching includes taking in the morning and reporting ringing in the ears?
questions.explanation: Clients on Loop diuretics must remember to patient teaching includes taking in the morning and reporting ringing in the ears.

questions.text: Which medication or class prevent monoamine breakdown but can cause hypertensive crisis?
questions.explanation: MAOIs prevent monoamine breakdown but can cause hypertensive crisis.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to demand tyramine restriction to prevent severe hypertension?
questions.explanation: MAOIs is linked to demand tyramine restriction to prevent severe hypertension.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to require nurses to review for drug–drug interactions before new prescriptions?
questions.explanation: MAOIs therapy requires nurses to require nurses to review for drug–drug interactions before new prescriptions.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes teaching includes carrying a dietary list that excludes aged cheeses and cured meats?
questions.explanation: Clients on MAOIs must remember to teaching includes carrying a dietary list that excludes aged cheeses and cured meats.

questions.text: Which medication or class lowers hepatic glucose output without causing weight gain?
questions.explanation: Metformin lowers hepatic glucose output without causing weight gain.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to rarely causes lactic acidosis, especially with renal or hepatic impairment?
questions.explanation: Metformin is linked to rarely causes lactic acidosis, especially with renal or hepatic impairment.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to must be held before contrast imaging to protect kidneys?
questions.explanation: Metformin therapy requires nurses to must be held before contrast imaging to protect kidneys.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes clients learn to take it with meals to minimize GI upset?
questions.explanation: Clients on Metformin must remember to clients learn to take it with meals to minimize GI upset.

questions.text: Which medication or class suppresses thyroid hormone synthesis for hyperthyroidism?
questions.explanation: Methimazole suppresses thyroid hormone synthesis for hyperthyroidism.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to may injure the liver, prompting periodic liver function tests?
questions.explanation: Methimazole is linked to may injure the liver, prompting periodic liver function tests.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to requires clients to report fever or sore throat due to agranulocytosis risk?
questions.explanation: Methimazole therapy requires nurses to requires clients to report fever or sore throat due to agranulocytosis risk.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes teaching includes contraception planning before therapy and adherence to dosing schedule?
questions.explanation: Clients on Methimazole must remember to teaching includes contraception planning before therapy and adherence to dosing schedule.

questions.text: Which medication or class rapidly reverses opioid-induced respiratory depression?
questions.explanation: Naloxone rapidly reverses opioid-induced respiratory depression.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to can precipitate acute withdrawal with hypertension and pain?
questions.explanation: Naloxone is linked to can precipitate acute withdrawal with hypertension and pain.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to may need repeat dosing when long-acting opioids are involved?
questions.explanation: Naloxone therapy requires nurses to may need repeat dosing when long-acting opioids are involved.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes caregivers keep devices accessible and call emergency services after use?
questions.explanation: Clients on Naloxone must remember to caregivers keep devices accessible and call emergency services after use.

questions.text: Which medication or class bind mu receptors for potent analgesia in severe pain?
questions.explanation: Opioids bind mu receptors for potent analgesia in severe pain.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to release histamine causing hypotension if pushed rapidly IV?
questions.explanation: Opioids is linked to release histamine causing hypotension if pushed rapidly IV.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to require monitoring respiratory rate and sedation level before repeat dosing?
questions.explanation: Opioids therapy requires nurses to require monitoring respiratory rate and sedation level before repeat dosing.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes teaching includes using stool softeners and avoiding driving while titrating doses?
questions.explanation: Clients on Opioids must remember to teaching includes using stool softeners and avoiding driving while titrating doses.

questions.text: Which medication or class spares potassium while antagonizing aldosterone in the distal nephron?
questions.explanation: Spironolactone spares potassium while antagonizing aldosterone in the distal nephron.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to is contraindicated in severe renal failure because potassium accumulates quickly?
questions.explanation: Spironolactone is linked to is contraindicated in severe renal failure because potassium accumulates quickly.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to requires monitoring for hyperkalemia when combined with ACE inhibitors or ARBs?
questions.explanation: Spironolactone therapy requires nurses to requires monitoring for hyperkalemia when combined with ACE inhibitors or ARBs.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes teaching includes avoiding salt substitutes and reporting endocrine changes such as gynecomastia?
questions.explanation: Clients on Spironolactone must remember to teaching includes avoiding salt substitutes and reporting endocrine changes such as gynecomastia.

questions.text: Which medication or class increase synaptic serotonin to treat depression and anxiety?
questions.explanation: SSRIs increase synaptic serotonin to treat depression and anxiety.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to take several weeks to reach full effect, so adherence coaching is essential?
questions.explanation: SSRIs is linked to take several weeks to reach full effect, so adherence coaching is essential.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to require monitoring for serotonin syndrome when layered with other serotonergic agents?
questions.explanation: SSRIs therapy requires nurses to require monitoring for serotonin syndrome when layered with other serotonergic agents.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes teaching covers daily dosing even when symptoms improve and vigilance for sexual side effects?
questions.explanation: Clients on SSRIs must remember to teaching covers daily dosing even when symptoms improve and vigilance for sexual side effects.

questions.text: Which medication or class lower LDL by inhibiting HMG-CoA reductase?
questions.explanation: Statins lower LDL by inhibiting HMG-CoA reductase.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to carry rhabdomyolysis risk, especially with concurrent fibrates?
questions.explanation: Statins is linked to carry rhabdomyolysis risk, especially with concurrent fibrates.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to require baseline and periodic liver enzyme monitoring?
questions.explanation: Statins therapy requires nurses to require baseline and periodic liver enzyme monitoring.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes clients take the dose at night and report unexplained muscle pain?
questions.explanation: Clients on Statins must remember to clients take the dose at night and report unexplained muscle pain.

questions.text: Which medication or class stimulate pancreatic insulin secretion to lower glucose?
questions.explanation: Sulfonylureas stimulate pancreatic insulin secretion to lower glucose.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to lose effectiveness as beta-cell reserve declines?
questions.explanation: Sulfonylureas is linked to lose effectiveness as beta-cell reserve declines.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to require screening for sulfa allergies and monitoring for hypoglycemia?
questions.explanation: Sulfonylureas therapy requires nurses to require screening for sulfa allergies and monitoring for hypoglycemia.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes teaching includes avoiding alcohol that provokes disulfiram-like reactions?
questions.explanation: Clients on Sulfonylureas must remember to teaching includes avoiding alcohol that provokes disulfiram-like reactions.

questions.text: Which medication or class treat mild hypertension by reducing sodium reabsorption in the distal tubule?
questions.explanation: Thiazide diuretics treat mild hypertension by reducing sodium reabsorption in the distal tubule.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to can elevate calcium and uric acid, worsening gout?
questions.explanation: Thiazide diuretics is linked to can elevate calcium and uric acid, worsening gout.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to require assessing for dehydration, dizziness, and orthostasis?
questions.explanation: Thiazide diuretics therapy requires nurses to require assessing for dehydration, dizziness, and orthostasis.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes teaching includes emphasizing foods rich in potassium to offset mild losses?
questions.explanation: Clients on Thiazide diuretics must remember to teaching includes emphasizing foods rich in potassium to offset mild losses.

questions.text: Which medication or class treats serious gram-positive infections including MRSA?
questions.explanation: Vancomycin treats serious gram-positive infections including MRSA.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to infusing too quickly causes red man syndrome from histamine release?
questions.explanation: Vancomycin is linked to infusing too quickly causes red man syndrome from histamine release.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to requires trough levels before the fourth dose to avoid toxicity?
questions.explanation: Vancomycin therapy requires nurses to requires trough levels before the fourth dose to avoid toxicity.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes teaching includes reporting hearing changes or balance issues promptly?
questions.explanation: Clients on Vancomycin must remember to teaching includes reporting hearing changes or balance issues promptly.

questions.text: Which medication or class blocks vitamin K-dependent clotting factors to prevent thrombosis?
questions.explanation: Warfarin blocks vitamin K-dependent clotting factors to prevent thrombosis.

questions.text: Which medication is linked to interacts with many antibiotics that raise INR to dangerous levels?
questions.explanation: Warfarin is linked to interacts with many antibiotics that raise INR to dangerous levels.

questions.text: Which medication requires the nurse to requires reviewing INR results prior to each administration?
questions.explanation: Warfarin therapy requires nurses to requires reviewing INR results prior to each administration.

questions.text: Which medication teaching plan includes teaching stresses consistent vitamin K intake and wearing medical identification?
questions.explanation: Clients on Warfarin must remember to teaching stresses consistent vitamin K intake and wearing medical identification.
